title: Density - mass of sphere from radius and density

content.question: The density of copper is <math alttext="8960 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8960</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. The mass of a copper sphere with a radius of <math alttext="0.03 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.03</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1.26 times 10 to the negative 8 power kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.26</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
